attributes.action: Support the right to protest without fear of retrubution
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: I hope that the Islam4UK protest in Wootton Bassett will go ahead and will go ahead peacefully to proove that we really do live in a free, democratic society. These are, after all the principles that our troops are risking their lives to uphold. I also hope that we can take the opportunity to show Britain in it's best light and line the streets to pay our respects to the 100,000s of people of all races who have died in these wars, not to scream abuse at Islam 4 UK and give our enemies propoganda to use against us. It is possible to be against the war but still be 100% behind our brave troops.

rejection.details: Islam4UK has decided they will not protest at Wootton Bassett which means your petition is no longer valid. You may wish to resubmit a more general petition that does not directly relate to this particular march.
reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
